data.title: Scholarships and Awards
data.meta_description: As a community based, not-for-profit financial institution, CFCU is passionate and committed to helping our members, youth, and communities succeed.
data.text:
These Scholarship options are available to:

High school seniors and non-traditional students planning to enter college for the first time are encouraged to apply.

For students planning to attend a 4-year college or university

One-time awards up to $3,000 each - awarded as two equal amounts across two semesters of study.

Application if attending a 4-yr college

For students planning to attend a 2-year college

One-time awards up to $1,500 each - awarded as two equal amounts across two semesters of study.

Application if attending a 2-yr college

APPLICANTS MUST:

Be high school seniors or others preparing to begin full-time study at 2- or 4-year accredited colleges

Reside in Tompkins, Cortland, Cayuga, Seneca, Onondaga, Madison, and Ontario Counties

Open a membership savings account in the applicantâ€™s name before Friday, March 22, 2024

Complete and submit the application form, letters of recommendation, and official transcript by Friday, March 22, 2024

Recipients will be chosen based on a variety of factors, including extracurricular and community involvement, letters of recommendation, completion of an essay, and academic achievement. Scholarships may be used towards the many expenses related to a college education.

This Scholarship is available to:

CORE, a division of CFCU Community Credit Union members who are high school seniors or full-time college students at an accredited degree granting institution.

For students

One-time awards up to $1,000 each

Application

APPLICANTS MUST:

Be a member of CORE, a division of CFCU Community Credit Union.

Be either a high school senior or full-time college students at an accredited degree granting institution.

Reside in Onondaga or Madison Counties.

Application must be postmarked no later than Friday, March 15, 2024.

Recipients will be chosen based on a variety of factors, including their financial need and academic performance.

CFCU proudly continued its support of local area students striving to better themselves and our local communities. In 2024, we awarded over $57,000 in Scholarships and Awards to high school graduates!

Your success is our passion!
